column2: WISCONSIN DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Wisconsin

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
column4: yield

column2: 2. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: On slippery roads.
column6: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column8: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Four-lane highway ahead

column2: 4. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You must increase your speed
column6: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear
column8: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding

column2: 5. A yellow arrow means:
column4: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column6: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column8: The same as a steady yellow light.

column2: 6. When passing a motorcycle you must:
column4: give the motorcyclist the entire traffic lane as if the motorcycle was a car.
column6: sound your horn to alert the motorcyclist.
column8: stay in the right lane as much as possible.
column10: give the motorcyclist the right hand part of his traffic lane.

column2: 7. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
column4: double solid yellow

column2: 8. If you drive slower than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:
column4: improve traffic flow.
column6: interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.
column8: help create a safe driving environment.

column2: 9. If another car is in danger of hitting you, you should:
column4: flash your brake lights.

column2: 10. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column4: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column6: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column8: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.

column2: 11. A flashing red traffic light:
column4: is used to indicate a pedestrian crossing.
column6: indicates that you should drive with caution.
column8: has the same meaning as a stop sign.
column10: has the same meaning as a yield sign.

column2: 12. When approaching an intersection with a traffic control signal that is not working, drivers should:
column4: try not to stop if the intersection is clear.
column6: stop as you would if there were stop signs in all directions, yield the right-of-way, then enter the intersection.
column8: speed up and proceed through the intersection.

column2: 13. When driving in icy or snowy conditions, to avoid crashes drivers should:
column4: engage 4 wheel drive on the vehicle.
column6: add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction.
column8: reduce speed and increase following distance.
column10: get off the highway as quickly as possible.

column2: 14. Drivers should use high beam headlights when:
column4: when they come within 50 feet of an oncoming vehicle.
column8: there are no oncoming vehicles approaching.

column2: 15. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
column4: School zone

column2: 16. To avoid traction loss from hydroplaning, drivers should:
column4: slow down.
column6: apply the brakes as soon as the car starts to skid.

column2: 17. When driving on major highways you should:
column4: keep your eyes moving.
column8: be ready to react to road hazards.

column2: 18. Drivers should allow a larger space cushion when stopping:
column4: at a yield sign.

column2: 19. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: once you have moved into the exit lane.
column6: once you see the toll booth.
column8: before moving into the exit lane.
column10: when you first see the exit sign.

column2: 20. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.
column8: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.

column2: 21. A broken white line:
column4: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column6: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column8: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.

column2: 22. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: No one.

column2: 23. Hydroplaning is usually caused by:
column4: sudden turns.

column2: 24. If the vehicle you are driving starts to skid, you should:
column4: turn off the ignition.

column2: 25. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column4: to the pedestrian.
column6: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column2: 26. Drivers approaching an intersection with a flashing yellow light should:
column4: slow down and proceed with caution.

column2: 27. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must not make a right turn.
column6: they must make a left turn at the intersection.

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column4: Railroad crossing

column2: 29. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column6: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.
column8: only if you have an emergency.
column10: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column4: Pedestrians walking along the road ahead

column2: 31. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 32. The traffic light is red and you want to turn right. You can turn:
column4: when the traffic with the green light is clear.
column8: if there is no speed limit.

column2: 33. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column6: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column8: turn left into the one-way road.
column10: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 34. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the speed limit on that route.
column6: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column8: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.
column10: the type of route you are on.

column2: 35. This sign is a:
column4: warning sign.

column2: 36. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column6: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column10: The driver can legally pass red lights.

column2: 37. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column8: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 38. This road sign means:
column4: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 39. This sign means:
column4: Hairpin corner ahead.

column2: 40. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column4: waterplaning.

column2: 41. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.
column10: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 42. This road sign means:
column4: Merge, then slow down to the safe speed indicated
column6: Winding road ahead; slow down to the indicated speed
column8: The road ahead curves right; slow down to indicated speed
column10: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated

column2: 43. Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian:
column4: on the opposite side of the street.
column8: if you have the green light.

column2: 44. In 55 MPH traffic you are least likely to be involved in a collision if you:
column4: drive a few MPH faster than most.
column8: drive a few MPH slower than most.

column2: 45. The picture shows:
column4: a railroad advance warning sign.

column2: 46. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Parallel railroad crossing (side road)

column2: 47. At night, it is hardest to see:
column4: other motorists.

column2: 48. This road sign means:
column4: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column6: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column10: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.

column2: 49. If you are feeling tired while driving, you should:
column4: stop and get some rest.

column2: 50. To drive defensively you should:
column4: look only at the car in front of you while driving.
column6: always put one car length between you and the car ahead.
column8: keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards.
